name: Hobbit Cafe
history: Started in 1972, Hobbit Cafe has drawn all kinds of celebrities with its fresh, stellar food.
comment: Pick between delicious healthy or dangerous food, and beer over 10% ABV

name: Ruggles Green
history: Formed in late 2008, Ruggles Green is Houston's first Certified Green Restaurants.
comment: Never had a bad experience here, I recommend their lettuce wraps and burgers.

name: Torchy's Tacos
history: Another awesome chain that started in Austin, TX.
comment: Whatever you decide to order, don't forget the Diablo sauce!

name: Hugo's
history: Hugo Ortega lives the American Dream, having immigrated to Houston from Mexico and building his award-winning restaurant empire from nothing.
comment: Sometimes, I prefer just ordering multiple appetizers instead of a main course...they're THAT good!
cons: This is a formal restaurant so it can be a bit pricey.

name: Campesino Cofee House
alcohol: I think they may have beer
history: Campesino is a relatively new cofee shop that takes a Latin perspective on the Montrose coffee culture.
comment: You have to try their cafe con leche (with soy milk).

name: Fadi's Mediterranean Grill
alcohol: I think they may have beer
history: Fadi himself came from Saida, Lebanon and opened Fadi's shortly after his family created Dimassi's
comment: So much food, so much freshness!

name: Doc's
alcohol: I think they may have beer
history: Fadi himself came from Saida, Lebanon and opened Fadi's shortly after his family created Dimassi's
comment: So much food, so much freshness!
